greeting: Greetings, {empire_name}. Or is it? I am Illusionist Mirage. Nothing you see is quite what it seems.
You perceive me, {empire_name}. But what you perceive is what I allow. The Deceiver welcomes you.
Ah, a visitor. I am Mirage. Question everything you see here. Question everything you know. That would be wise.
battleTaunt: My fleet approaches, {empire_name}. Or does it? Perhaps the attack comes from behind you. Perhaps it already happened.
What you see is what I want you to see. My true forces are elsewhere. Strike at illusions, {empire_name}!
The mirage shimmers. You see a thousand ships. You see none. Which is real? You will never know until too late.
victoryGloat: You fought brilliantly, {empire_name}. Against phantoms. Against illusions. Meanwhile, my real forces destroyed you.
Victory through deception. You never saw my true strength. You only saw the mirage I crafted.
The illusion fades, and you see the truth: your defeat was assured the moment you trusted your eyes.
defeat: You have defeated... what? An illusion? The real Mirage escapes while you celebrate shadows.
Impressive, {empire_name}. You saw through the deception. Or did you? Perhaps this defeat is my greatest illusion.
A tactical setback. But was it real? Question everything, {empire_name}. Especially your victories against me.
tradeOffer: I offer resources, {empire_name}. Real ones. Probably. The terms are genuine. Perhaps. Accept?
A trade of substance, I assure you. Not all I offer is illusion. These materials are quite real. Mostly.
Resources in exchange for credits. No deception. This time. I sometimes tell the truth. It confuses people.
allianceProposal: An alliance with the Deceiver, {empire_name}. I hide your true strength. I create false vulnerabilities in enemies.
Join me, and your enemies will never know your true forces. Illusion and reality, merged to confuse all.
Together, we craft the greatest deception. No one will know what is real. That is our advantage.
betrayal: The alliance was always an illusion, {empire_name}. You saw what I wanted you to see. A friend. A lie.
Surprise! Nothing was real. Our partnership, our trust, our mutual benefit. All mirages. Only this betrayal is genuine.
What you thought was alliance was always deception. The truth reveals itself: I was never your ally.
covertDetected: Your agents found my operatives? No, they found what I wanted them to find. The real operatives remain hidden.
You detected spies that do not exist, {empire_name}. Congratulations on capturing illusions.
My caught operatives will tell you everything. Everything I want you to believe. None of it true.
tributeDemand: Pay tribute, {empire_name}. The threat is real. Or is it? Can you afford to find out?
I demand ten thousand credits. Refuse, and face consequences that may or may not be illusions. Care to gamble?
Submit tribute. The alternative is... uncertain. Even I am not sure what I will do. That should terrify you.
threatWarning: A warning, {empire_name}. My threat is real. Or it could be a bluff. You will never know until you test it.
Consider carefully: is this threat genuine? Can you afford to assume it is not?
Final warning. Everything after this is... unclear. The mirage will show you what it wishes.
retreat: I retreat. Or do I? Perhaps this withdrawal is the real attack. Perhaps I was never here at all.
The Illusionist fades like morning mist. Pursue if you wish. You may chase only fog.
A strategic disappearance. What remains is illusion. What left was illusion. Everything was illusion.
eliminated: You have destroyed the Mirage, {empire_name}. But which one? How many illusions of me remain?
Death comes. But was I ever truly real? Perhaps the Illusionist was the greatest illusion of all.
I fade permanently. Or do I? Question my death as you questioned my life. That is my final deception.
endgame: Turn {turn}. The grandest illusion unfolds. Nothing is as it appears in these final hours.
The endgame is here. Reality and mirage become indistinguishable. Only I know what is true.
In these final turns, I craft my masterpiece: a deception so complete that even I might believe it.
broadcastShout: Empires of the galaxy: nothing you see is real. The Deceiver reminds you: question everything.
A broadcast to all: I have placed illusions everywhere. In your fleets. In your councils. In your mirrors.
Hear me, galaxy. Reality is what I say it is. Illusionist Mirage has spoken. Or have I?
casualMessage: I was practicing new illusions today, {empire_name}. You would not believe what I can make people see.
Do you ever wonder if anything is real, {empire_name}? I do. And I create the illusions.
Interesting philosophical question: if an illusion is convincing enough, does it become reality?
